casebody.data:
ESTATE OF WILLIAM R. DERRY. No. 8710 Oct. 24, 1878. Will.—Execution oe.—Witness’ signature by his mark attested by go-witness. One of the witnesses to a will may write the signature of his associate witness to the will when such associate witness is unable to write, and may then write his own name as a witness that such illiterate witness has attested the execution of the will by his mark. Construing section, C. 0., 1276.

C. Halsey, for proponent.

J. M. Allen, for contestant.

*203One of the witnesses to the will did not write his name, being uneducated. The other witness, besides signing as a witness to the will, wrote the name of his associate witness, and wrote his own name as a witness to the mark of the associate.

Held, this is a good witnessing of the will.
